message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms of self-inflicted wounds, fear of abandonment, unstable relationships, and mood swings all suggest borderline personality disorder. Histrionic personality disorder is characterized by attention-seeking behavior, while dependent personality disorder is characterized by a pervasive need to be taken care of. Cyclothymic disorder is a milder form of bipolar disorder characterized by mood swings that are less severe and shorter in duration than those in bipolar disorder.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient exhibits unstable and intense relationships, recurrent self-harm behavior, and a fear of abandonment, which are all characteristic of borderline personality disorder. Histrionic personality disorder is characterized by attention-seeking behavior, but this patient’s behavior is more focused on her relationship and fear of abandonment. Cyclothymic disorder is a milder form of bipolar disorder and would present with more pronounced and longer-lasting mood swings. Dependent personality disorder involves a pattern of submissive and clinging behavior, which is not present in this patient.

Dependent personality disorder is characterized by a pervasive reliance on others, but not self-injury, relationship instability, or mood swings.
